adjectives.description: hotshot (comparative more hotshot, superlative most hotshot)

examples: He was a hotshot lawyer, with an astounding win-loss record.
Keep up those hotshot baskets, the scouts are sure to take notice.

entries.meaning: (informal) Someone with exceptional skills in a certain field.
examples: She sure was a hotshot on the keyboard, 93 words per minute!

entries.meaning: A type of firefighter highly skilled in wildfire firefighting without external support, using basic tools that are backpacked in and manhandled about.
(US, rail transport) A fast freight train.
examples: Indeed, development proceeded so rapidly thereafter that Mopac, for instance, was rebuilding a series of 10-year-old Woodard 2-8-4's into 4-8-4's by 1940 - not because they couldn't steam but because their 63-inch drivers couldn't roll the hotshots fast enough.

entries.meaning: (slang) A dose of recreational drugs deliberately laced with poison.
examples: I sniffed glue, transmission fluid, gasoline, whatever drug anybody gave me, I took.  [â€¦]  [Y]ears ago, I was in a drug rehabilitation program and found out that my brother was killed after somebody gave him a hotshot, drugs laced with poison.

verbs.description: hotshot (third-person singular simple present hotshots, present participle hotshotting, simple past and past participle hotshotted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang) To give (somebody) a dose of recreational drugs deliberately laced with poison.
